summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T Southeast, dated June 6, 2019, demanding telephone records for the period January 1, 2002 through December 31, 2006, as part of a criminal investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and coercion statutes. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter requesting non-disclosure of the subpoena to preserve investigation confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoff E. Becan
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena as the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which AT&T Southeast Custodian of Records is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The United States Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to AT&T Southeast for telephone records from 2002-2006.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
AT&T Southeast, 308 S. Akard, 14th Floor, Dallas, TX 75202
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, New York
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement).
The investigation is being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York, indicating a serious federal probe.

The subpoena specifically requests all telephone records (calls, texts, subscriber info, etc.) for certain numbers from January 1, 2002, through December 31, 2006, targeting a specific five-year period.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests non-disclosure of the subpoena's existence to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality and prevent interference.
The document demonstrates active investigative steps in the Epstein case as of June 2019, focusing on evidence from the early-to-mid 2000s.
